Specific Details: Mental Health Reform Pre-Budget Campaign - TD Clinic Visits with constituents
DPOs Lobbied: George Lawlor|Councillor|Wexford County Council::Derek Nolan|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Richard Bruton|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Mental Health Reform Pre-Budget Campaign - TD Clinic Visits with constituents
Intended Results: To ensure that each TD would support Mental Health Reform's Pre- Budget Campaign asks in any budget negotiations
Lobbying Activities: Mental Health Reform organised small groups of local constituents to visit TD's in their clinics. Four TD clinic meetings were held in the lobbying reporting period: Wexford  (30th September 2015), Castlebar (2nd October 2015), Galway (5th October 2015) and Dublin (8th October 2015).|Meeting|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Lara Kelly, Communications and Campaigns Officer, Mental Health Reform

Intended Results: Political support for completion of gas network in Wexford

Specific Details: The Subject Matter of this lobbying was to discuss the possibility introducing Protocol standards for Twinning/Networking Agreementa and if the Local Authority in Wexford were interested in our Programmes.
Subject Matter: The Subject Matter of this lobbying was to discuss the possibility introducing Protocol standards for Twinning/Networking Agreementa and if the Local Authority in Wexford were interested in our Programmes.
Intended Results: To Hopefully be involved in the ongoing Twinning or as we like to call the network to develop such agreements to benefit all members of society in the areas of , Community, Sport, Arts & Culture, Commerce, Toutism , Youth Groups Exchange Programmes in Education and Community development Plans
Lobbying Activities:
Wexford County Council Office 
Mr George Lawlor was present as was Ania Adamowska who is a collogue of mine.
We present Mr Lawlor with our protocol Programme for him to view and we will then hopefully hav a follow up meeting in relation to our proposals|Meeting|1

Specific Details: A number of issues were raised at a meeting with Brendan Howlin regarding Rosslare Europort,  Brexit, IDA Investment in Wexford,N11 completion, SE University, Secondary School requirements,  Loretto School completion of works and  opening, Minimun Wage, Broadband roll-out for Wexford.
DPOs Lobbied: Brendan Howlin|Minister|Department of Public Expenditure and Reform::George Lawlor|Councillor|Wexford County Council
Subject Matter: A number of issues were raised at a meeting with Brendan Howlin regarding Rosslare Europort,  Brexit, IDA Investment in Wexford,N11 completion, SE University, Secondary School requirements,  Loretto School completion of works and  opening, Minimun Wage, Broadband roll-out for Wexford.
Intended Results: Feedback on action being undertaken by the minister and further actions required to gain future investment for Wexford. Wexford Chamber aim was to highlight specific issues and create awareness of the  Wexford business community needs.
Lobbying Activities: There was 1 meeting on 18th May 2018 with Brendan Howlin TD and Cllr George Lawlor held in the SIPTU Office in Coolcotts, Wexford|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Niall Reck, President Wexford Chamber, Graham Scallan Vice President Wexford Chamber, Enda Kavanagh CEO Wexford Chamber

Specific Details: Councillor George Lawlor visited RehabCare facility in Co. Wexford  to discuss the difficulties faced by people in wheelchairs in the local community.
Subject Matter: Councillor George Lawlor visited RehabCare facility in Co. Wexford  to discuss the difficulties faced by people in wheelchairs in the local community.
Intended Results: To appeal to the local government to improve the accessibility of local transport and footpaths.
Lobbying Activities:
Cllr George Lawlor visited RC Centre, Wexford on 16 November to discuss and witness first-hand  the difficulties that people in wheelchairs face while trying to go about their daily lives in the area. 
Cllr Lawlor was invited to attend the next Local Advocacy Committee meeting in the centre which will take place in February 2024. |Meeting|1
